p: Microfinance offers a range of small-amount financial products, aiming to address market failures (Gatto, 2018). Indeed, microfinance intends to provide the poor and vulnerable categories with solutions to face the imperfection of credit, banking and insurance markets (Armendáriz and Morduch, 2010; Ray, 2008). Microfinance includes microcredit, saving programmes, financial payment facilitation, micropension and microinsurance schemes and remittances facilitations (Gatto, 2021). These tools are today recognised as leading strategies to address resilience policies (FAO, 2016).
